<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:12%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	amount represents health premiums paid on behalf of the Named Executive Officer in excess of premiums paid for other employees.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	amount represents the amount paid in connection with the new fixed payment agreement entered into with Mr.&nbsp;Dahan in February 2013. One-half of
	Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's payment was made at the close of the Asset Sale and the remainder was paid at the close of the Merger in January 2016. See also "Employment Contracts and Termination of Employment
	and Change in Control Arrangements&#151;Joseph M. Dahan" for a further discussion of this fixed payment agreement.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Furrow
	did not receive any additional compensation for his service as interim chief executive officer from January 2015 until January 2016. This
	amount represents his stock award for service as a member of our board of directors for fiscal 2014.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	connection with Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's resignation on January&nbsp;19, 2015, we granted Mr.&nbsp;Crossman 600,000 shares of restricted common stock,
	which vests 1/12
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;on a monthly basis over the twelve&nbsp;(12) period of his consultant agreement. This figure represents the aggregate dollar amount of the original grant. See
	also footnote (2)&nbsp;above for discussion on compensation amount.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(6)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	a discussion on the fixed payment agreement entered into with Mr.&nbsp;Dahan, please see "Employment Contracts and Termination of Employment and
	Change in Control Arrangements&#151;Joseph M. Dahan."
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Outstanding Equity Award at 2015 Fiscal Year-End
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth information regarding outstanding equity awards held by our Named Executive Officers during our fiscal
	year ended November&nbsp;30, 2015. These amounts have not been adjusted to reflect the Reverse Stock Split that was declared on January&nbsp;28, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	In
	connection with Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's resignation on January&nbsp;19, 2015, we granted Mr.&nbsp;Crossman 600,000 shares of restricted common stock,
	which vests 1/12
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;on a monthly basis over the twelve (12)&nbsp;period of his consultant agreement. This figure represents the amount remaining to vest as of November&nbsp;30,
	2015.

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Contracts and Termination of Employment and Change in Control Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Change in Control Provisions
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to its termination in September 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's employment agreement contained certain change in control provisions.
	These provisions provided him with certain compensation arrangements in the event that a change in control occurs. Prior to its termination in January 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Crossman also had a change in
	control provision in his employment agreement that would have provided him with certain compensation arrangements in the event a change of control occurred prior to its termination. In addition, our
	Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan and 2004 Stock Incentive Plan each contain a change in control provision which provides for the
	immediate vesting in full of all grants or lapse of all restrictions for all grantees, including our Named Executive Officers, in the event a change in control occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Marc Crossman
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On May&nbsp;30, 2008, we entered into an Executive Employment Agreement, or the Crossman Employment Agreement, with
	Mr.&nbsp;Crossman to serve as our President and Chief Executive Officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=68,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=801691,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DS45801A.;28',USER='JFUSS',CD='29-FEB-2016;13:19' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS45801_1_67">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Crossman
	was previously serving as our President since September 2004 and as our Chief Executive Officer since January 2006 under an employment at-will arrangement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;19, 2015, our Board of Directors accepted the resignation of Mr.&nbsp;Crossman from his positions. The Board and Mr.&nbsp;Crossman also agreed that
	Mr.&nbsp;Crossman would become a consultant for a period of twelve (12)&nbsp;months pursuant to a Consulting Agreement. In exchange for a release of all claims related to Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's
	employment and the provision of consulting services by Mr.&nbsp;Crossman, we have agreed to pay Mr.&nbsp;Crossman the following: (i)&nbsp;payment of $35,775.00 per month for a period of twelve
	(12)&nbsp;months; (ii)&nbsp;acceleration of the unvested equity awards previously granted to Mr.&nbsp;Crossman; (iii)&nbsp;granted him restricted common stock in the amount of 600,000 shares
	that vest 1/12th&nbsp;on a monthly basis over the twelve (12)&nbsp;month period; and (iv)&nbsp;agreed to reimburse him for health and dental COBRA payments for a period of twelve
	(12)&nbsp;months or until he is eligible for coverage under a successor employer's group health plan. Mr.&nbsp;Crossman is subject to confidentiality, non-solicitation and non-competition
	restrictions for a period of two years following termination of his employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the terms of the Crossman Employment Agreement before his resignation, Mr.&nbsp;Crossman received an annual salary of $429,300 and was entitled to receive other cash and non-cash
	compensation, including an annual discretionary bonus targeted at 50% of his base salary based upon the achievement of financial and other performance criteria as set forth in the Crossman Employment
	Agreement, an annual grant of equity compensation pursuant to our stock incentive plans, and life and disability insurance policies paid on his behalf. The Crossman Employment Agreement was effective
	as of December&nbsp;1, 2007, the commencement of our 2008 fiscal year, and had an initial term of two years, which automatically renewed for another two year period on December&nbsp;1, 2009,
	December&nbsp;1, 2011 and December&nbsp;1, 2013, respectively before it was terminated on January&nbsp;19, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event that Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's employment would have been terminated by us other than for Cause, terminated by Mr.&nbsp;Crossman for Good Reason, terminated by us within
	18&nbsp;months following a Change in Control and without Cause, or terminated by Mr.&nbsp;Crossman within 18&nbsp;months following a Change in Control and for Good Reason, Mr.&nbsp;Crossman
	would have been entitled to certain severance payments and benefits, including an amount equal to 24&nbsp;months of his prior year's base salary and bonus in exchange for his execution of a release
	of claims. Mr.&nbsp;Crossman was not entitled to severance benefits if he died during the term of his employment, he was terminated for Cause or due to Disability, he terminated his employment for a
	reason other than a good reason, or revoked his agreement to release us from any and all claims related to his employment. "Cause" under the Crossman Employment Agreement was defined as:
	(i)&nbsp;conviction of an offense involving an act of dishonesty, fraud or any other act of moral turpitude, or using alcohol, narcotics or illegal drugs to such an extent that it repeatedly
	materially adversely affects executive's performance hereunder; (ii)&nbsp;substantial and willful failure to perform specific and lawful written directives of the Board; (iii)&nbsp;willful and
	knowing violation of any rules or regulations of any governmental or regulatory body that is materially injurious to the financial condition of the Company; (iv)&nbsp;conviction of or plea of guilty
	or nolo contendere to a felony or an act of moral turpitude; or (v)&nbsp;a material breach of the terms and conditions of the employment agreement. "Disability" was defined as executive's incapacity
	due to physical or mental illness (as determined in good faith by a physician acceptable to the Company and executive), (i)&nbsp;absent from the full-time performance of his duties for 120
	consecutive days during any 12&nbsp;month period or (ii)&nbsp;if a physician acceptable to the Company and executive advises us that it is likely that executive will be unable to return to the
	full-time performance of his duties for 120 consecutive days during the succeeding 12&nbsp;month period. "Good Reason" was defined as: (i)&nbsp;a material breach of the employment agreement by us
	that is not cured in the applicable time periods; (ii)&nbsp;relocation of the Company more than 50 miles from Commerce, California; or (iii)&nbsp;a material reduction in Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's base
	salary. A "Change in Control" was defined as: (i)&nbsp;a change in the our incumbent directors such that they no longer constitute a majority of the directors; (ii)&nbsp;any person
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=69,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=209616,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DS45801A.;28',USER='JFUSS',CD='29-FEB-2016;13:19' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS45801_1_68">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	or
	entity becoming the beneficial owner of 50% or more of our combined voting power; (iii)&nbsp;the consummation of a merger, consolidation, share exchange or other corporate transaction involving
	us that requires the approval of our stockholders where our stockholders as a group no longer own at least 50% of the voting power of the surviving corporation or our Board members do not constitute a
	majority of the new board members of the surviving corporation; or (iv)&nbsp;the approval by our stockholders to liquidate or dissolve.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Joseph M. Dahan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the completion of a merger between us, our Joe's Sub and JD Holdings in October 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's employment
	agreement automatically became effective
	for service as our Creative Director. Under the employment agreement, the initial term of employment was for five years with automatic renewals for successive one year periods thereafter, unless
	terminated earlier. Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was entitled to an annual salary of $300,000 and other discretionary benefits that the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors may deem appropriate in its
	sole and absolute discretion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the Asset Sale, we entered into a separation agreement, pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Dahan resigned as a member of the Board and as our Creative Director, effective as
	of September&nbsp;11, 2015. In exchange for a release of all claims related to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's employment, we paid Mr.&nbsp;Dahan his termination severance as provided in his employment
	agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the terms of the employment agreement, if we terminated the employment of Mr.&nbsp;Dahan for Cause or for Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's Disability, we would only be required to pay him
	through the date of termination. "Cause" was defined as: (i)&nbsp;a conviction, plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a felony or a crime of moral turpitude; (ii)&nbsp;a material breach of any
	provision of the employment agreement that is not cured within 45&nbsp;days of receipt of written notice of such breach; (iii)&nbsp;the solicitation, persuasion or attempt at persuasion for any
	employee, consultant, contractor, customer or potential customer to engage in an act prohibited by the employment agreement; or (iv)&nbsp;a violation of any of our policies in our handbook or code
	of ethics and such violation constitutes a breach of the Code of Ethics or warrants termination. "Disability" was defined as inability to perform duties for 180 consecutive days or shorter periods
	aggregating 270&nbsp;days during any 12&nbsp;month period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, we could terminate Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's employment without Cause at any time upon two weeks' notice, provided that we paid him the present value of the annual salary amounts
	otherwise due to him for the remainder of the initial term of employment or any renewal term. Mr.&nbsp;Dahan could have terminated his employment for Good Reason at any time within 30&nbsp;days
	written notice. "Good Reason" was defined as: (i)&nbsp;a material breach of the employment agreement by us that is not cured within 30&nbsp;days of written notice or (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's
	decision to terminate employment at any time after 18&nbsp;months following a Change in Control. A "Change in Control" was defined as (i)&nbsp;the sale or disposal of all or substantially all of
	the assets; (ii)&nbsp;the merger or consolidation with another company provided that our stockholders as a group no longer own at least 50% of the voting power of the surviving corporation;
	(iii)&nbsp;any person or entity becoming the beneficial owner of 50% or more of our combined voting power; or (iv)&nbsp;the approval by our stockholders to liquidate or dissolve. In the event that
	Mr.&nbsp;Dahan terminated his employment for Good Reason, then he would have been entitled to the present value of the annual salary amounts otherwise due to him for the remainder of the initial
	term of employment or any renewal term. Further, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan could have terminated his employment for any reason upon ten business days' notice and only be entitled to his salary as of the date
	of termination on a pro rata basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	employment agreement contained customary terms and conditions related to confidentiality of information, ownership by us of all intellectual property, including future designs and
	trademarks, alternative dispute resolution and Mr.&nbsp;Dahan's duties and responsibilities to us as Creative Director.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=70,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=868003,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DS45801A.;28',USER='JFUSS',CD='29-FEB-2016;13:19' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS45801_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, pursuant to the merger agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was entitled to, for 120&nbsp;months following October&nbsp;25, 2007, irrespective of his employment status,
	additional contingent consideration payments based upon our achievement of certain gross profit thresholds on sales from our Joe's&reg; brand products. On February&nbsp;18, 2013, we entered
	into a new agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Dahan that provided certainty of payments to him by removing the contingencies related to the contingent consideration payments. This agreement fixed the overall
	amount to be paid by us for the remaining months of year six through year 10 with payments being made over an accelerated time period until November 2015 instead of October 2017. Under the agreement,
	the total aggregate amount Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was entitled to receive $9,168,000 in weekly installments until November 2015. However, as a result of our default under the CIT Revolving Credit Agreement
	and the Garrison Term Loan Credit Agreement, we were prohibited from making any payments to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan during 2015. One-half of the amount remaining to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was paid at the close of
	the Asset Sale and the remainder was paid at the close of the Merger in January 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Peter Kim
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the acquisition of Hudson, we entered into an employment agreement with Peter Kim pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Kim
	serves as the Chief Executive Officer of Hudson. The employment agreement became effective on September&nbsp;30, 2013 upon completion of the acquisition of Hudson, and had a term of three years.
	Mr.&nbsp;Kim's initial base salary was $500,000 per year, and such amounts were to be reviewed by the Compensation Committee at least annually, provided that the base salary was decreased during
	Mr.&nbsp;Kim's term of employment. In addition to his base salary, Mr.&nbsp;Kim was eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus targeted at 50% of his base salary, based on the satisfaction
	of criteria and performance standards as established in advance and agreed to by Mr.&nbsp;Kim and the Compensation Committee. The employment agreement also provided Mr.&nbsp;Kim with certain other
	benefits and the reimbursement of certain expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Kim's employment for any reason or no reason, we were required to pay Mr.&nbsp;Kim for (i)&nbsp;his accrued but unpaid base salary through
	the date of termination, (ii)&nbsp;any accrued but unused vacation time, (iii)&nbsp;any unreimbursed expenses, and (iv)&nbsp;any bonus amounts that have been earned but have not been paid, and
	any bonus for the period in which termination occurred, prorated for the partial period, any rights under any benefit or equity plan, program or practice, and his rights to indemnification and
	directors and officers liability insurance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, in the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Kim's employment without Cause or in the event that Mr.&nbsp;Kim voluntarily terminated his employment for "Good Reason", we
	were also required (i)&nbsp;to make a severance payment to Mr.&nbsp;Kim equal to twelve months of his base salary, payable in twelve monthly installments and (ii)&nbsp;pay for the COBRA premiums
	(to the extent they exceed applicable active employee rates) on our group medical plan for Mr.&nbsp;Kim and his spouse and dependents for the shorter of the first 12&nbsp;months of such coverage
	or his period of COBRA eligibility. Our obligation to provide the foregoing severance benefits is subject to Mr.&nbsp;Kim's execution of a settlement agreement and release. "Cause" is defined as the
	same as the Crossman Employment Agreement. "Good Reason" is defined as (i)&nbsp;a material breach of the employment agreement by us that is not cured in the applicable time periods;
	(ii)&nbsp;relocation of the Company more than 50 miles from Commerce, California; (iii)&nbsp;requiring Mr.&nbsp;Kim to report to anyone other than the CEO of the Company (iv)&nbsp;a material
	breach by us of any provision of the employment agreement; or (v)&nbsp;a material reduction in Mr.&nbsp;Kim's base salary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	employment agreement also contained exclusivity, non-compete and non-solicitation covenants generally prohibiting Mr.&nbsp;Kim from providing services to a competitor during the
	term of his employment or soliciting employees during the term of his employment and for 12&nbsp;months following his termination of employment. In addition, the employment agreement mandated that
	Mr.&nbsp;Kim's confidentiality obligations continue even after his termination of employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=71,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=1010999,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DS45801A.;28',USER='JFUSS',CD='29-FEB-2016;13:19' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS45801_1_70">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Kim
	has also entered into a non-competition agreement which also became effective on September&nbsp;30, 2013 upon completion of the acquisition of Hudson, pursuant to which
	Mr.&nbsp;Kim has agreed not to engage in, compete with or permit his name to be used by or in connection with any premium denim apparel business outside his role with Hudson, that is competitive to
	us, Hudson or our respective subsidiaries, or to solicit certain personnel for a period of up to three years from the closing of the acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;8, 2015, we entered into a new three-year Employment Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Kim to serve as the Chief Executive Officer of Hudson that replaced his previous
	employment agreement as of January&nbsp;28, 2016. Mr.&nbsp;Kim's annual base salary is $600,000 and Mr.&nbsp;Kim is eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus targeted at 50% of his base
	salary, based on the satisfaction of criteria and performance standards as established in advance by the Compensation Committee. The Employment Agreement also provides Mr.&nbsp;Kim with certain
	other benefits and the reimbursement of certain expenses. On January&nbsp;28, 2016, we granted Mr.&nbsp;Kim (i)&nbsp;restricted stock units in respect of 166,667 shares of common stock that vest
	and become transferable in three equal, annual installments beginning on January&nbsp;28, 2017, subject to Mr.&nbsp;Kim's continuous employment and (ii)&nbsp;performance share units in respect
	of 166,667 shares of the common stock that will be earned over a three-year performance period. One-third of the performance shares will be entitled to vest each year based on annual performance
	metrics established by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of the applicable year. The restricted stock award and performance shares will be settled in cash, unless we are able to attain
	stockholder approval of a new equity incentive plan covering such awards. Mr.&nbsp;Kim will also be
	entitled to participate in all regular long-term incentive programs maintained by us or Hudson on the same basis as similarly-situated employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Kim's employment for any reason or no reason, we have agreed to pay Mr.&nbsp;Kim for (i)&nbsp;his accrued but unpaid base salary through
	the date of termination, (ii)&nbsp;any accrued but unused vacation time, (iii)&nbsp;any unreimbursed expenses, and (iv)&nbsp;if not previously paid to Mr.&nbsp;Kim: any bonus amounts that have
	been earned but have not been paid; any bonus for the period in which termination occurred, prorated for the partial period, with the amount, if any, based on actual performance and paid when bonuses
	for the applicable period are paid to other senior executives; any rights under any benefit or equity or long-term incentive plan, program or practice; and his rights to indemnification and directors
	and officers liability insurance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, in the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Kim's employment by us without "cause" (as defined in the Employment Agreement) or in the event that Mr.&nbsp;Kim voluntarily
	terminates his employment for "good reason" (as defined in the Employment Agreement), we are also required to make a severance payment to Mr.&nbsp;Kim equal to twelve months of his base salary,
	payable in twelve monthly installments. Additionally, any unvested portion of the restricted stock award will immediately vest and become transferable and any unvested performance shares will continue
	to vest without regard to Mr.&nbsp;Kim's continued employment. We have agreed to also pay for the COBRA premiums (to the extent they exceed applicable active employee rates and subject to
	Mr.&nbsp;Kim timely electing continuation coverage under COBRA) on our group medical plan for Mr.&nbsp;Kim and his spouse and dependents for the shorter of the first 12&nbsp;months of such
	coverage or his period of COBRA eligibility. Our obligation to provide the foregoing severance benefits is subject to Mr.&nbsp;Kim's execution of a settlement agreement and release for us and our
	subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Employment Agreement also contains exclusivity, non-compete and non-solicitation covenants generally prohibiting Mr.&nbsp;Kim from providing services to a competitor during the
	term of his employment or soliciting employees during the term of his employment and for 12&nbsp;months following his termination of employment. During the term, Mr.&nbsp;Kim is permitted to own
	and interest in and, when not employed by Hudson, take part in and manage or operate relating to certain other apparel businesses conducted by Mr.&nbsp;Kim's family from time to time that are not
	competitive with us and our
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	subsidiaries.
	In addition, the Employment Agreement mandates that Mr.&nbsp;Kim's confidentiality obligations continue even after his termination of employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Kim
	has also entered into a non-competition agreement, which became effective as of January&nbsp;28, 2016, pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Kim has agreed not to engage in,
	compete with or permit his name to be
	used by or in connection with any premium denim apparel business outside his role with Hudson, that is competitive to us or our subsidiaries for a period of up to three years from January&nbsp;28,
	2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Hamish Sandhu
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's appointment as Chief Financial Officer, we entered into a written offer letter whereby
	Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu agreed to serve as our Chief Financial Officer. Under the terms of the offer letter, Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's annual base salary was $205,000, which was increased to $255,000 in November
	2008 and $280,000 in December 2012. We also agreed to pay the full cost of participation in our health insurance plan for Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu and his family. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary,
	until July 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu was an employee at-will.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	July&nbsp;2, 2015, we entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu. Under the terms of the employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu will receive an initial base salary
	of $325,000, and such amount will be reviewed by the Compensation Committee at least annually, provided that the base salary may not be decreased during Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's term of employment. In
	addition to his base salary, Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu will be eligible to receive an annual discretionary cash and equity bonus of not less than 10&nbsp;percent of his base salary, based upon the
	achievement of financial and other performance criteria as established in advance by the Compensation Committee, and with respect to the 2015 fiscal year, as set forth in the employment agreement. The
	employment agreement also provides Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu with certain other benefits, including premiums for health insurance paid on his behalf and for his family, and life and disability insurance
	policies paid on his behalf. The employment agreement is effective as of July&nbsp;2, 2015 and has an initial term of one year. The employment agreement automatically renews for additional one year
	periods if neither we nor Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu provide 90&nbsp;days' advanced notice of non-renewal prior to the end of the term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's employment for any reason or no reason, we must pay Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu for (i)&nbsp;his accrued but unpaid base salary through the
	date of termination, (ii)&nbsp;any accrued but unused vacation time, (iii)&nbsp;any unreimbursed expenses, (iv)&nbsp;any bonus amounts that have been earned but have not been paid,
	(v)&nbsp;any rights under any benefit or equity plan, and (vi)&nbsp;any ongoing rights to indemnification and directors and officers liability insurance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, in the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's employment by us without "Cause" or in the event that Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu voluntarily terminates his employment for "Good
	Reason", we will also be required (i)&nbsp;to make a severance payment to Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu equal to his annual base salary, payable in equal installments in accordance with our normal payroll
	practices, (ii)&nbsp;any bonus amounts that have been earned for the period in which termination occurred, prorated for the partial period, and (iii)&nbsp;pay for the COBRA premiums (to the extent
	they exceed applicable active employee rates) on our group medical plan for Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu and his spouse and dependents for the shorter of the first 12&nbsp;months of such coverage or his period
	of COBRA eligibility. Our obligation to provide the foregoing severance benefits is subject to Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's execution of a settlement agreement and release. "Cause" is defined
	as (i)&nbsp;conviction of an offense involving an act of dishonesty, fraud or any other act of moral turpitude under the provisions of any Federal, State or local laws or ordinances;
	(ii)&nbsp;willful failure to perform, or gross negligence in performing, executive's duties owed to us, after notice; (iii)&nbsp;willful and knowing violation of any rules or regulations of any
	governmental or regulatory body that is materially injurious to the financial condition of us; (iv)&nbsp;conviction of or plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a felony; (v)&nbsp;material breach of
	the terms of the employment agreement by Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu; (vi)&nbsp;any breach by the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=73,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=381719,FOLIO='71',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DS45801A.;28',USER='JFUSS',CD='29-FEB-2016;13:19' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS45801_1_72">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</A>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	executive
	of the executive's fiduciary duty of care or duty of loyalty to us or (vii)&nbsp;commission of an act of dishonesty, fraud or misrepresentation which results in material harm to us or our
	business. "Good Reason" is defined as (i)&nbsp;a material adverse alteration in the nature or status of Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's responsibilities; (ii)&nbsp;relocation of the Company more than 10 miles
	outside of Los Angeles County, California; (iii)&nbsp;a material breach by us of our obligations under the employment agreement, or (iv)&nbsp;a reduction in Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's then current
	salary, in each case that is not cured within the applicable time periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	employment agreement also contains exclusivity, non-compete and non-solicitation covenants generally prohibiting Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu from providing services to a competitor during the
	term of his employment or soliciting employees during the term of his employment and for 12&nbsp;months following his termination of employment. In addition, the employment agreement mandates that
	Mr.&nbsp;Sandhu's confidentiality obligations continue even after his termination of employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Michael Buckley
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;28, 2016, in connection with the transactions contemplated by the Merger Agreement, we entered into an employment
	agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Buckley. Pursuant to the terms of the employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Buckley serves as Chief Executive Officer, reporting to our Board of Directors, for an initial
	three-year term with automatic, one-year renewal terms, unless we or Mr.&nbsp;Buckley gives notice 180&nbsp;days prior to the end of the then-current term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	employment agreement provides that we will pay Mr.&nbsp;Buckley an annual base salary of $600,000 and that Mr.&nbsp;Buckley will be eligible to receive an annual bonus of up to
	150% of his base salary, based on our achievement of annual EBITDA targets set by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors after consultation with Mr.&nbsp;Buckley.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	employment agreement also provides that the Company will grant Mr.&nbsp;Buckley a restricted stock unit award in respect of 433,764 shares of our common stock (the
	"
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	RSU Award
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"). The RSU Award will vest in annual installments over a three-year period with the first installment vesting on December&nbsp;31, 2016,
	subject to Mr.&nbsp;Buckley's continued employment through the applicable vesting dates. The Company will also grant Mr.&nbsp;Buckley a performance share unit award in respect of 347,011 shares of
	our common stock (the "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	PSU Award
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"). The PSU Award will vest in annual installments over a three-year period, based on the our achievement of EBITDA
	targets set by the Compensation Committee and subject to Mr.&nbsp;Buckley's continued employment through the applicable vesting dates. The employment agreement further provides that the RSU Award
	and the PSU Award will be settled in cash in the event that there are insufficient shares of the Company's common stock available to settle the applicable award in our common stock and that unvested
	portions of the PSU Award in any completed year will be eligible for vesting in subsequent years to the extent that the subsequent year EBITDA target is exceeded and the excess is sufficient to make
	up for a prior year shortfall. Upon a "change in control" (as defined in the employment agreement), any unvested portions of the RSU Award and PSU Award will immediately vest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Buckley's employment by us without "cause" or in the event that Mr.&nbsp;Buckley resigns for "good reason" (each, as defined in the
	employment agreement), in either case, prior to the expiration of the agreement's then-current term, we will pay Mr.&nbsp;Buckley severance equal to 3.75 times his base salary. Upon such termination
	or resignation, Mr.&nbsp;Buckley and his dependents will receive continued coverage under our group health insurance plans for a period of up to 18&nbsp;months, any unvested portion of the RSU
	Award will immediately vest, 50% of the unvested portion of the PSU Award will immediately vest and 50% of the unvested portion of the PSU Award will remain outstanding through completion of the
	applicable performance period and vest based on actual achievement of the performance metrics. In the event such resignation or termination occurs following our first fiscal quarter of any year, the
	employment agreement provides that Mr.&nbsp;Buckley will also be entitled to a prorated annual bonus for the year in which his employment terminates. Our obligation to provide the foregoing
	severance benefits is subject to Mr.&nbsp;Buckley's execution and non-revocation of a release of claims against us and our affiliates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	72
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The employment agreement also contains customary provisions relating non-disclosure and non-disparagement. In addition, the employment agreement includes
	12-month, post-termination non-competition and non-solicitation provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan, 2004 Stock Incentive Plan, Restricted Stock
	Agreement and Restricted Stock Unit Awards
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms both of the Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan and the 2004 Stock Incentive Plan, all unvested awards
	accelerate and immediately vest upon the occurrence of a Change in Control for all grantees. Further, Mr.&nbsp;Crossman's Restricted Stock Agreement and each RSU Award contains certain provisions
	regarding the terms and conditions of the grant. Each vests upon the earliest to occur of the participant's Death, Disability (each as defined in the Plan), or separation from service by us without
	Just Cause (as defined below). Upon a separation from service for any other reason (including, without limitation, termination by us for Just Cause or by
	participant for any reason) prior to the date that participant becomes 100&nbsp;percent vested in the award, the unvested units or shares are forfeited immediately. Under the award agreements, "Just
	Cause" means (a)&nbsp;a conviction for, or a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to, a felony or any other crime which involves fraud, dishonesty or moral turpitude, or (b)&nbsp;a material breach of
	any written employment policies or rules, including our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Director Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically, our non-employee directors have been compensated for service through an equity grant or on a cash basis. Our non-employee
	directors are not compensated in any other manner; however, they are reimbursed for travel and business expenses associated with attending our annual meeting if the director's schedule permits such
	attendance or other in person meetings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;15, 2016, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors approved a cash payment of $98,000 to each of the directors for their service in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	than the cash payment of $98,000 to Mr.&nbsp;Furrow for his board service in 2015, during which period he also served as interim chief executive officer, members of our Board of
	Directors who are employees receive no additional compensation for service as members of our Board of Directors. Members of our Board of Directors who also serve on one or more committees of our Board
	of Directors do not receive any additional compensation for such service.
</FONT>

</EFX_COMPENSATION>
<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_DU45801_ITEM_12__SECURITY_OWNERSHIP_OF__ITE04035">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DU45801_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDERS MATTERS.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table provides information as of February&nbsp;25, 2016 concerning beneficial ownership, as that term is defined in
	Rule&nbsp;13d-3 of the Exchange Act, of common stock held by (1)&nbsp;each person or entity known by us to beneficially own more than 5% of our outstanding common stock, (2)&nbsp;each of our
	directors and nominees for election as a director, (3)&nbsp;each of our named executive officers, and (4)&nbsp;all of our directors and executive officers as a group. The information as to
	beneficial ownership has been furnished by our respective common stockholders, directors and executive officers, and, unless otherwise indicated, to our knowledge, each of our common stockholders has
	sole voting and investment power with respect to the shares beneficially owned, subject to community property laws where applicable. Pursuant to the rules of the SEC, certain shares of our common
	stock that a beneficial owner set forth in this table has a right to acquire within 60&nbsp;days of the date hereof (pursuant to the exercise of options or warrants for the purchase of shares of
	common stock) are deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of that owner, but are not deemed outstanding for the purpose of computing percentage ownership of any
	other beneficial owner shown in the table. Percentages are calculated based on 12,403,240 shares outstanding (excluding
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	treasury
	shares) as of February&nbsp;25, 2016. The address for the officers and directors is our corporate office located at 1231 South Gerhart Avenue, Commerce, California, 90022.

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Equity Compensation Plan Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth certain information about our common stock that may be issued upon the exercise of options, warrants and
	rights under all of our compensation plans (including individual compensation arrangements) under which our equity securities are authorized for issuance as of November&nbsp;30, 2015, which includes
	our Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan and our 2004 Stock Incentive Plan. We stopped granting options under our 2004
	Stock Incentive Plan after the adoption and approval of our Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan on October&nbsp;26, 2011. These amounts have not been adjusted to reflect the Reverse Stock
	Split that was declared on January&nbsp;28, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>

	"Amended and Restated 2004 Stock Incentive Plan" and "2004 Stock Incentive Plan" described in "Notes to Consolidated Financial

</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=79,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=559796,FOLIO='77',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DU45801A.;14',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2016;15:59' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DU45801_1_78">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	While
	there are shares available, we no longer grant options under our 2004 Stock Incentive Plan since the adoption and approval of our Amended and Restated
	2004 Stock Incentive Plan on October&nbsp;26, 2011.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
</EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_DU45801_ITEM_13__CERTAIN_RELATIONSHIPS__ITE03048">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DU45801_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Audit Committee charter provides that that all transactions between us and persons or entities affiliated with our officers,
	directors or principal common stockholders must be approved by our Audit Committee. We believe that this policy requiring that any material transaction between us and such related parties be approved
	by our Audit Committee ensures that such transactions are on terms no less favorable to us than reasonably could have been obtained in arms' length transactions with independent third parties. For
	fiscal 2015, our related party transactions, all of which were previously approved by our Audit Committee, are described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Joe Dahan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since the acquisition of the Joe's&reg; brand as a result of a merger in October 2007 through February&nbsp;18, 2013,
	Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was entitled to a certain percentage of our gross profit in any applicable fiscal year until October 2017. At the time of the acquisition, pursuant to ASC 805&#151;Business
	Combinations, we assessed this original contingent consideration arrangement as compensatory and expensed such amounts over the term of the earn out period at the defined percentage amounts. For the
	fiscal year ended 2013, expense of $311,000 was recorded in the statement of net (loss) income and comprehensive (loss) income related to the contingent consideration expense made to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan
	under the original agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	February&nbsp;18, 2013, we entered into a new agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Dahan that fixed the overall amount to be paid by us for the remaining months of year six through year 10 in
	the original merger agreement at $9,168,000 through weekly installment payments beginning on February&nbsp;22, 2013 until November&nbsp;27, 2015. In the first quarter of fiscal 2013, we recorded a
	charge of $8,732,000 as contingent consideration buy-out expense in connection with this agreement. This amount represented the net present value of the total fixed amount that Mr.&nbsp;Dahan would
	receive. The entire amount was expensed during the first quarter of fiscal 2013 as the amount payable represented a present obligation due to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan. On September&nbsp;30, 2013, in
	connection with entry into new credit facilities relating to the acquisition of Hudson, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan, CIT, Garrison and all of our loan parties entered into an earn-out subordination agreement,
	which provides, among other things, that any payment, whether in cash, in-kind, securities or any other property, in connection with the our obligations to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan is expressly junior and
	subordinated in right of payment to all amounts due and owing upon any indebtedness outstanding under the CIT Revolving Credit Agreement and the Garrison Term Loan Credit Agreement. As a result of our
	defaults pursuant the Garrison Term Loan Credit Agreement and CIT Revolving Credit Agreement, we did not make any buy-out payments to Mr.&nbsp;Dahan during fiscal 2015. In connection with the Asset
	Sale, Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was repaid a portion of the buy-out payment owed to him and the remainder was paid at the closing of the Merger and the Merger Transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Albert Dahan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In April 2009, we entered into a commission-based sales agreement with Albert Dahan, brother of Mr.&nbsp;Dahan, for the sale of our
	products into the off- price channels of distribution that was subsequently terminated beginning in fiscal 2014. Under the agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Albert Dahan was entitled to a commission for purchase
	orders entered into by us where he acts as a sales person. For the fiscal year ended 2014 and 2015, there were no payments made to Mr.&nbsp;Albert Dahan under this arrangement. For fiscal years
	ended 2013, payments of $453,000 were made to Mr.&nbsp;Albert Dahan under this arrangement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=80,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=238357,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]DU45801A.;14',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2016;15:59' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DU45801_1_79">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227457Z10-K_HTM_BG45801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2011, we entered into an agreement with Ever Blue&nbsp;LLC, or Ever Blue, an entity for which Albert Dahan is the sole member, for the sale of children's products. Ever Blue
	has an exclusive right to produce, distribute and sell children's products bearing the Joe's&reg; brand on a worldwide basis, subject to certain limitations on the channels of distribution. In
	exchange for the license, Ever Blue pays to us a royalty on net sales with certain guaranteed minimum sales for each term. In connection with this agreement, we provided initial funding to Ever Blue
	for inventory purchases, which such amount has been repaid in full. For the fiscal years ended 2015, 2014 and 2013, we recognized $45,000, $504,000 and $612,000, respectively in royalty income under
	the license agreement. In connection with the Asset Sale, this agreement was assigned to the Operating Assets Purchaser.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Peter Kim
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have entered into several agreements, including a stock purchase agreement, a convertible note, a registration rights agreement, an
	employment agreement and a non-competition agreement with Peter Kim in connection with the acquisition of Hudson. See "Notes to Consolidated Financial
	Statement&#151;Note&nbsp;9&#151;Debt" for a further discussion of those agreements. In connection with the Merger, we entered into the Rollover Agreement and the Employment Agreement.
	For a discussion of the Rollover Agreement and terms of the Modified Convertible Notes, see "Notes to Consolidated Financial Statement&#151;Note&nbsp;2&#151;Subsequent Events." For a
	discussion of the Employment Agreement, see "Item&nbsp;11&#151;Employment Contracts and Termination of Employment and Change in Control Arrangements."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements with Officers and Directors
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have entered into employment agreements with Michael Buckley, our Chief Executive Officer, Marc Crossman, our former President and
	Chief Executive Officer, Joe Dahan, our former Creative Director, Peter Kim, our Chief Executive Office of our Hudson subsidiary and Hamish Sandhu, our Chief Financial Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Dahan was
	previously a member of our Board of Directors until September 2015 and Mr.&nbsp;Kim was previously a member of our Board of Directors until
	February 2015. See "Item&nbsp;11&#151;Employment Contracts and Termination of Employment and Change in Control Arrangements" for a further discussion of these agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Director Independence
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently, the following members of our Board of Directors are considered "independent" under NASDAQ listing standards and as such term
	is defined in the rules and regulations of the SEC:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	Matthew Eby;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

</FONT>

</FONT>

</FONT>
</DT>

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	making its determination that the foregoing directors are independent, the Board of Directors considered all relevant facts and circumstances. There are no current transactions with
	members of the Board of Directors that needed to be considered for any impact on the respective member's independence. We do not have any past or present members serving on our Audit Committee,
	Compensation Committee and Nominating and Governance Committee that are not considered to be independent based on the applicable rules of NASDAQ and the SEC.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_ACCOUNTANT_FEES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTANT_FEES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_DU45801_ITEM_14__PRINCIPAL_ACCOUNTING_FEES_AND_SERVICES_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DU45801_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTING FEES AND SERVICES.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In October 2014, our Audit Committee approved the engagement of Moss Adams&nbsp;LLP, or Moss Adams, as our independent registered
	public accounting firm for the year ended November&nbsp;30, 2014 and dismissed Ernst&nbsp;&amp;Young&nbsp;LLP, or E&amp;Y, our previous independent registered public accounting firm for the first three
	quarters of fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	table below shows the aggregate fees billed by Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young for professional services rendered in connection with the our annual financial statements set forth in our Annual
	Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal years ended November&nbsp;30, 2014 prior to the dismissal of Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young in October 2014; the review of our unaudited quarterly financial
	statements set forth in our Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q for our first three fiscal quarters during 2014; the audit of our fiscal 2014 and 2013 revised financial statements for discontinued
	operations; the S-4 registration statement work in connection with the Merger:
</FONT>
</P>

	our Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal years ended November&nbsp;30, 2015 and November&nbsp;30, 2014; the audit of our internal control over financial reporting as of
	November&nbsp;30, 2014; the review of our unaudited quarterly financial statements set forth in our Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q for our fiscal quarters during 2015 and 2014; the audit of
	our fiscal 2014 revised financial statements for discontinued operations; the S-4 registration statement work in connection with the Merger; as well as fees for audit-related work, tax compliance, tax

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Audit Committee has adopted a policy which requires the Audit Committee's pre-approval of audit and non-audit services performed by the independent auditor to assure that the
	provision of such services does not impair the auditor's independence. The Audit Committee approves such services on an on-going basis prior to the incurrence of any such audit and non- audit
	services. The Audit Committee pre-approved all of the audit and non-audit services rendered by E&amp;Y prior to their dismissal in October 2014 and Moss Adams listed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Audit Committee has determined that the services provided by E&amp;Y and Moss Adams were compatible with maintaining both E&amp;Y's and Moss Adams' independence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	80
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FC45801_1_1">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->

</EFX_EXHIBITS>
</EFX_PART_IV>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_FC45801_REPORT_OF_INDEPENDENT___FC402282">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FC45801_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	The Board of Directors and Stockholders of
<BR>
	Differential Brands Group&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries (formerly Joe's Jeans&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheet of Differential Brands Group&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries (the "Company") as of November&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, the related
	consolidated statements of comprehensive loss, stockholders' equity, and cash flows for the years then ended. Our audits also
	included the financial statement schedule for the two years ended November&nbsp;30, 2015 listed in the Index at Item&nbsp;15(a). These consolidated financial statements and schedule are the
	responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements and schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
	obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements are free of material misstatement. The Company is not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its
	internal control over financial reporting. Our audit included consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the
	circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also
	includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the consolidated financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made
	by management, as well as evaluating the overall consolidated financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Differential Brands
	Group&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries as of November&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, and the consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows for the years then ended, in conformity with
	accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Also, in our opinion the financial statement schedule for the two years ended November&nbsp;30, 2015, when considered in
	relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	Moss Adams&nbsp;LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	Los Angeles, California
<BR>
	February&nbsp;29, 2016
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=93,EFW="2227457",CP="DIFFERENTIAL BRAND GROUP INC.",DN="1",CHK=183751,FOLIO='F-1',FILE='DISK131:[16ZAG1.16ZAG45801]FC45801A.;5',USER='ABEAULI',CD='25-FEB-2016;13:31' -->
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FC45801_1_2">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_FC45801_REPORT_OF_INDEPENDENT___FC402296">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227457Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FC45801_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	The Board of Directors and Stockholders of
<BR>
	Differential Brands Group&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries (formerly Joe's Jeans&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have audited the accompanying consolidated statement of comprehensive loss, stockholders' equity, and cash flows for the year ended November&nbsp;30, 2013 of Joe's Jeans&nbsp;Inc.
	and subsidiaries, (the "
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"). Our audit also included the financial statement schedule for the year ended November&nbsp;30, 2013 listed in the
	Index at Item&nbsp;15(a). These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and
	schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
	obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
	the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
	presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows for the year ended
	November&nbsp;30, 2013 of Joe's Jeans&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiaries, in conformity with United States generally accepted accounting principles. Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement
	schedule for the year ended November&nbsp;30, 2013, when considered in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects the information set
	forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END -->
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/ Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young&nbsp;LLP
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Los
	Angeles, California
<BR>
	February&nbsp;13, 2014 (except for the effects of the discontinued
<BR>
	operations discussed in Note&nbsp;1 and Note&nbsp;4, as to which the
<BR>
	date is November&nbsp;2, 2015)
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
